body_html: @naba89 the issue is only for binary installs (which link against static libstdc++). For local source installs which dont do this, it doesn't matter. More specifically, I now specify a linker version script to not leak pytorch's static symbols outside of the local scope. This is the relevant commit 0b92e5c
body_text: @naba89 the issue is only for binary installs (which link against static libstdc++). For local source installs which dont do this, it doesn't matter. More specifically, I now specify a linker version script to not leak pytorch's static symbols outside of the local scope. This is the relevant commit 0b92e5c
body: @naba89 the issue is only for binary installs (which link against static libstdc++). For local source installs which dont do this, it doesn't matter. More specifically, I now specify a linker version script to not leak pytorch's static symbols outside of the local scope. This is the relevant commit https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/0b92e5c9ed1b62e695b10167f87621bbbcf0fc86
